column4: anyone know how to turn off the "logging" in when you start ubuntu?
menu > system > adim < login screen,  3rd tab I think
disable multible logins for a single user?
yes,  , you'll need to select which users logs inautomaticaly form the drop down list
scratch that ,  5th tab,   secutiry,    activate automatic login
not sure if it worked but I guess I will see next time I boot up
you did notice my second advice right ?  abut the 5th tab ?
no srry
scratch that ,  5th tab,   secutiry,    activate automatic login

congrats
just state the problem
is xp on the same hdd ? what is the nature of the problem , please make your next statement as complete as possible
yes they are both on the same hdd
sudo mkdir /media/WIN  && sudo mount -t ntfs /dev/??? /media/WIN
/dev/sda1 will probably the devtree for your windows partiton then
do i leave a "space" btwn /dev/sda1 and /media/win?
yes
still won't let me mount and I tried w/and w/out space
/dev/sda1 might not be it for you, run   sudo blkid in the terminal to get a listing of your partitions
you don'T need to run the sudo mkdir part of the command every time  only once just the stuff after && after that
says that it's in use by windows.... will shut dwn then power up again
